thread.title: The San Diego Lifestyle is a Tee-Hole Sponsor for Make-A-Wish San Diego Golf Classic
thread.title_full: The San Diego Lifestyle is a Tee-Hole Sponsor for Make-A-Wish San Diego Golf Classic - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: The San Diego Lifestyle is a Tee-Hole Sponsor for Make-A-Wish San Diego Golf Classic
text:
Donation to Help Kids With Life-Threatening Medical Conditions
San Diego, CA (PRWEB) October 14, 2015
The San Diego Lifestyle, http://sandiegolifestyleblog.com/ , an online lifestyle blog site, has made a Tee-Hole Sponsor donation to Make-A-Wish® San Diego for their 27th Annual Make-A-Wish Golf Classic held at The Crosby National Golf Club in Rancho Santa Fe, California. The San Diego Lifestyle’s mission is to be your guide for enjoying the active and luxury life.
“We are proud to be a sponsor of this great event, and all the good things that Make-A-Wish does for kids that are in very difficult circumstances,” said Patrick Henry, a co-founder of The San Diego Lifestyle. “Granting a life-affirming wish to children with life-threatening medical conditions is a very special thing, and Make-A-Wish is a very special organization.”
Patrick Henry is a co-founder of The San Diego Lifestyle blog. Mr. Henry is also the CEO of QuestFusion, http://questfusion.com/ , a San Diego-based consulting company focused on strategic guidance for startups. Patrick is a serial entrepreneur and the former CEO of Entropic Communications.
Patrick added, “In The San Diego Lifestyle, I try to impart my experience of the best ways to do the most fun things in San Diego. I’ve been in San Diego for over a decade, and have lived in California for 25 years, so I’ve seen a lot and done a lot. Of course it is great to go to a special event or activity, but it is even better if you know the best ways to do it!”
Amanda Cascadden, co-founder of The San Diego Lifestyle blog, is a residential real estate agent with Berkshire Hathaway Home Services (BHHS) in their Rancho Santa Fe office. Amanda is part of the INDRA Group at Berkshire Hathaway, a real estate team within BHHS, and loves to show people great places in San Diego.
Amanda said, “I came to The San Diego Lifestyle with a fresh set of eyes on all there is to do in this wonderful city. I grew-up in Michigan, and have only been living in San Diego a little over a year. It is an amazing place with incredible people and many fun things to do. I also work to cultivate our guest blogger network of experts in various aspects of the San Diego lifestyle. It is so much fun! I love what Make-A-Wish San Diego is working to accomplish in our city.”
About Make-A-Wish® San Diego: Make-A-Wish San Diego grants the wishes of children with life-threatening medical conditions in San Diego and Imperial Counties to enrich the human experience with hope, strength and joy. Since its inception in 1983, the San Diego chapter has granted more than 3,500 wishes to children in our community. In the coming year, the organization anticipates granting over 200 wishes for children in our community, and hosting over 200 Wish Kids from other states to grant their wish in San Diego. At Make-A-Wish, the goal is simple: to come into a child’s life during a difficult time and provide hope and a much-needed break from the daily challenges they are forced to face. For more information about Make-A-Wish San Diego, visit us online at http://www.sandiego.wish.org or call us at (858) 707-WISH.
About The San Diego Lifestyle: San Diego Lifestyle is blog site about the active and luxury life in San Diego. It reflects the yin and the yang, if you will, of living in San Diego. We promote fine and casual dining, nightlife, unique hotels, luxury and casual fashion, luxury real estate, fun travel destinations, and key points of interest. We write about life at home and the active lifestyle available to our residents. We share our experiences about fitness, health, home life, gardening, dining out, going to concerts and other fun events! We also share information about current events and key topics that affect our lives, and occasionally write about the business climate in our region and the collaborative nature of the business community in San Diego. Our web site can be found at http://sandiegolifestyleblog.com/ .
